title: Panthers HC Dave Canales gives very exciting update on G Robert Hunt
description: Panthers HC Dave Canales told reporters on Thursday that he's "very optimistic" about G Robert Hunt's outlook for this weekend's wild-card game.
fullText:
The Carolina Panthers may feel like they're about to get a big presence back for their first playoff game in eight years.

Head coach Dave Canales spoke with reporters on Thursday, following the last full practice ahead of this weekend's wild-card round matchup against the Los Angeles Rams. And when talking about the outlook for Pro Bowl right guard Robert Hunt, he delivered a pretty encouraging update.

"Status is questionable, but he had a great day. He had another fantastic day," Canales replied. "He was out there with his guys. I'm very optimistic about Rob playing‚Äîand I can't put anything official out there until, of course, we come up with the final roster and all that stuff. But he looked great."

Hunt missed the final 15 games of the regular season due to a torn biceps, a setback he sustained in the team's Week 2 loss to the Arizona Cardinals. The Panthers have fielded a handful of different offensive linemen in Hunt's place at right guard, with Austin Corbett receiving the last four starts at the position.

Canales later confirmed that Hunt would be the starter on Saturday if he's good to go.

"We're not gonna put him out there part-time," he stated. "And this is it. This is the only game we have. This is it. So he's gotta go, he's fired up to help out his teammates and, obviously, that'll be all official whenever it is."

The Panthers are expected to release their official injury report later today.

Follow¬†@ThePanthersWire¬†on Twitter/X for more Panthers content.

This article originally appeared on Panthers Wire: Panthers HC Dave Canales 'very optimistic' on G Robert Hunt's status

title: Angel Reese's Sky predicted to shake up WNBA Draft by taking triple-double machine
description: This would cheer up the Sky's star forward.
fullText:
Angel Reese's Sky predicted to shake up WNBA Draft by taking triple-double machine originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Despite trade rumors at the end of the 2025 season, Angel Reese is more likely than not to begin the 2026 WNBA campaign with the Chicago Sky.

However, the two-time All-Star made it clear last year that she would not endure another 10-34 season in the Windy City.

As such, Sky general manager Jeff Pagliocca needs to nail his selection in the first round of the loaded 2026 WNBA Draft, which will be held on April 13.

MORE:¬†WNBA nears unfortunate history amid stalled CBA negotiations

The Sky are picking fifth, which might put Chicago out of range for UConn sharpshooter Azzi Fudd. Given that the Sky are continuing to build around Reese and Kamilla Cardoso, Lauren Betts and Awa Fam may be viewed as redundant if they fall out of the top four.

Unless the Sky opt to trade the pick for more-immediate help, a new mock draft predicts that Chicago will draft TCU star Olivia Miles to transform their backcourt.

HoopsHype's Eden Laase writes that Miles is " one of the country‚Äôs top floor generals" who would be an easy fit next to Reese. Backcourt scoring and playmaking were major weaknesses for the 2025 Sky, and Miles would be an immediate fix even as a rookie.

Miles, who transferred to TCU from Notre Dame for her final season of NCAA eligibility, has ripped off four triple-doubles in her past seven games for the 13th-ranked Horned Frogs. She is averaging 19.3 points, 7.8 assists and 7.4 rebounds for TCU, which is one of the top teams in the country with a 15-1 record.

title: How to watch Arsenal vs Liverpool match tonight ‚Äì Live streaming and TV details
description: Arsenal vs Liverpool sets tone for winter title narrativeArsenal welcome Liverpool to the Emirates Stadium in a Premier League meeting that carries weight beyond a single evening. This is a fixture sh...
fullText:
Arsenal welcome Liverpool to the Emirates Stadium in a Premier League meeting that carries weight beyond a single evening. This is a fixture shaped by momentum, expectation and the quiet pressure that comes with sustaining belief across a long season. For Arsenal, the aim is continuity. For Liverpool, the task is relevance.

Both clubs arrive with unbeaten runs worth protecting. Arsenal have responded to early December disappointment with authority, five straight league wins restoring rhythm and confidence. Liverpool, unbeaten in nine across all competitions, have steadied themselves after a turbulent autumn, even if the league table offers an unforgiving reflection of their campaign.

Since the late setback against Aston Villa, Arsenal have rediscovered control. Performances have been sharp rather than spectacular, efficient rather than expansive. That consistency has lifted them back into contention and reinforced the sense that Mikel Arteta‚Äôs project continues to edge closer to tangible reward.

Progress to the Carabao Cup semi-final has added to that optimism. Supporters sense an opportunity not simply to win matches but to shape a season. Hosting Liverpool at this point of the campaign feels significant. Victory would represent a sixth consecutive league win and another statement that Arsenal are prepared to shoulder expectation rather than shy away from it.

The Emirates Stadium has increasingly become a place of assurance. Arsenal‚Äôs ability to dictate tempo at home has been central to their recent run, and tonight‚Äôs contest offers a chance to underline that authority against familiar opposition.

Liverpool‚Äôs story has been more complex. Their nine-game unbeaten sequence speaks of resilience, yet dropped points have left them 14 points adrift of the league leaders. Draws against Fulham, Leeds twice and Sunderland have dulled momentum, even as wins in the capital during this run hint at lingering threat.

Arne Slot‚Äôs side have not enjoyed a smooth defence of their Premier League title. Injuries, adaptation and inconsistency have shaped a season that has demanded patience. A win over Arsenal would not rewrite the campaign, but it could sharpen its conclusion, offering belief that Liverpool still have influence to exert.

In the UK, Arsenal vs Liverpool will be shown live on Sky Sports. Coverage begins at 7pm GMT on Sky Sports Main Event and Sky Sports Premier League, with kick off scheduled for 8pm.

Need a VPN to watch the match? Our preferred VPN to watch UK TV from anywhere is LibertyShield.com ‚Äì they offer a 48 hour no-obligation free trial and have apps or all popular devices including Mac, Windows, FireTV, iPhone/iPad and Android.

This meeting may not settle the Premier League race, but it will shape how the second half of the season feels for both clubs. For Arsenal, affirmation. For Liverpool, opportunity.

title: There is a lot to digest with no games to play for the Colts.
description: It‚Äôs going to be a while before we see any changes.
fullText:
I‚Äôll start by saying that it is probably healthier to just forget about last season and move on to how to win next year, but like many of you, I have to view the start of next season in a way that reminds me a lot of last season. The decision to remain status quo with our leadership, makes it difficult to see next year being different. I do not recall other organizations allowing such a long learning curve for the GM and Head Coach.

I, like most of you, went into Sunday evening thinking that the possibility existed of seeing the Colts make some changes in the GM and/or head coach. The sentiment was creeping in that they would be retained, but I didn‚Äôt hear any reasoning that I bought into (so that‚Äôs on me), and given the Colts have been good at keeping their business in house, I felt the odds might still be about 50-50. My personal choice was that they let both the GM and HC go. I felt that their ‚Äúmust win‚Äù opportunity was this past year and it had eluded them.

I‚Äôm more out on Steichen, based mainly on him appearing to be more involved in X‚Äôs and O‚Äôs, than getting 53 guys working together to win games. I simply do not think he can run the offense and the team at the same time. I‚Äôm out on Ballard because I wouldn‚Äôt want him finding my next coach, or any coach for that matter. I blame them both for the ‚ÄúRivers Experiment‚Äù. Not because I believe it failed, but because they did not understand that team building needs to be a constant phenomenon that is not abandoned when the going gets tough.

Steichen should have been a focusing on getting Leonard ready, the minute AR was injured. RL should have been taking first team reps as soon as Jones was injured and the HC should have been selling the team at each stop that Riley would be the man when needed and that they would rally around him, when and if he was called upon. Ballard should have had a QB that he had at least some level of confidence could be a backup on game day. If you had no thought that Rypien could fill that role, find someone else.

Riley Leonard had a pretty nice day for a season finale. I‚Äôm only counting the first half, since he saw the 2nd string in the 2nd half. He did score 17 in that half, against a team that only gives up 16 a game. This might make some fans say that you‚Äôve seen enough out of him to make him the starter or backup for next season. I‚Äôd like a little more info and I feel we got robbed of this by bringing in Rivers. A four game sample size might have exposed whether he was the guy making downfield connections, or the guy who threw a bad INT and fumbled. On the rushing touchdown he scored, he held the ball like a loaf of bread and a better hit might have seen him loose control. Even if him playing the four games didn‚Äôt reveal anything, it would have been four games against four stout defenses to put in his bag and four games of film to work on over the offseason.

Full disclosure, I was against bringing in Rivers the first time. I have a long memory when a player taunts a crowd as he exits a playoff game in our home stadium. Especially, when he didn‚Äôt play. By the way, when you are doing an interview, where a Colts hat. Yep, I‚Äôm old.

Part 2 here is an admission. I shared that I thought if Steichen was fired, I would just leave Cooter in place and have him call plays. After watching RL on the sidelines this week, I have to ask just what JBC contributes? SS obviously calls the plays. They showed Jones wearing a head set, sitting with the coaches upstairs and Turner sitting with RL on the sidelines, but what the heck was JBC doing? I saw him walk into the picture once and he was clapping. I may be wrong, but I‚Äôm not even sure he was wearing a headset? To see him calling plays is a suggestion that I‚Äôm glad no one paid attention to.

In that same scenario, I had Lou moving into the HC role. I guess I am not completely nuts, since he has been requested for an interview with two teams. It is possible that it is still a bad idea and that the teams inquiring are not looking in the right place for their next guy. I am hoping there is a bit more of a shakeup on the defensive side, aside from seeing Partridge leave. Health was a problem, but so was generating a real and visible pass rush, along with getting a LB where they need to be in coverage. It was likely more personnel than scheme.

We obviously need to make some changes and so far they haven‚Äôt come to the administration level. This likely means that unless someone sees Lou as the answer to their problems, all of our changes will involve players and we will not hear much about the roster until March 3rd, when we may have a sense of whether or not it takes the franchise tag to bring D. Jones back. Shortly afterwards, March 9 ‚Äì 11, we get the legal tampering with free agents. These are not secrets, so you know if you have acquired or lost players, rather quickly.

There is the combine sprinkled in there, but hopefully the scouting department is looking less at RAS, than guys who are good at football. Without a 1st round pick, it is going make our mock drafts a lot less fun. We honestly have very little to look forward to for the rest of January and all of February. This may see us ranting about last year, longer than we want to. I know I just did.

So, I‚Äôve laid my blame at the feet of the GM and the HC. Do you have a different villain, or maybe the same villains for a different reason? Feel free vent, so that you can put 2025 in the rear view mirror.

title: Thurston wrestler wins Register-Guard girls Athlete of the Week
description: This week's nominees were from Harrisburg and Thurston wrestling and Springfield basketball.
fullText:
Thurston wrestler Molly Cummings is the winner of the Eugene-Springfield high school girls Athlete of the Week, as voted by Register-Guard readers.

Cummings won all seven of her bouts, five by fall and two by forfeit, in the 125-pound class Dec. 29-30 at the Northwest Duals in Albany.

Cummings received 58.71% of the reader poll votes. Teammate Kaylee Hadden was second (27.75%).

Harrisburg senior Izabella Castleberry was the runner-up in the 170-pound division Dec. 30 at the Sierra Nevada Classic in Reno. Castleberry entered the tournament as the No. 21 seed before upsetting four higher-ranked opponents to reach the final.

Over the course of four games at the Tarkanian Classic in Las Vegas, Springfield freshman forward Nuari Filipe averaged 21.5 points and 10.7 rebounds to lead the Millers to four straight wins.

Thurston's Kaylee Hadden won all six of her matches ‚Äî four by fall and two by forfeit ‚Äî in the 110-pound class Dec. 29-30 at the Northwest Duals in Albany.

Harrisburg sophomore Eden Ridgley captured the 100-pound title Dec. 30 at the Sierra Nevada Classic in Reno. Ridgley defeated Reed's Eliana Santos-Banks in the final.

To submit an Athlete of the Week nomination, please email Register-Guard sports reporter Jarrid Denney at jdenney@registerguard.com with the athlete's name, stats and any other relevant information about the performance they are being nominated for.

This article originally appeared on Register-Guard: Thurston wrestler wins girls Athlete of the Week

title: NFL takes Brian Flores case to Supreme Court on issue of arbitration
description: Nearly four years after the lawsuit was first filed, a key threshold question is moving toward a final answer.
fullText:
Nearly four years after the lawsuit was first filed, a key threshold question is moving toward a final answer.

The NFL has filed a petition for writ of certiorari with the United States Supreme Court as to the question of whether the civil action filed in February 2022 by former Dolphins coach (and current Vikings defensive coordinator) Brian Flores against the NFL, the Dolphins, the Giants, the Broncos, and the Texans will be resolved in court, or in arbitration.

The specific legal question presented to the Supreme Court is this: "Whether an arbitration agreement governing disputes in a professional sports league is categorically unenforceable under the Federal Arbitration Act because it designates the league commissioner as the default arbitrator and permits the commissioner to develop arbitral procedures."

The NFL has wisely narrowed the question, given that the reasoning (if applied throughout corporate America) would empower other companies to attempt to rig the in-house arbitration process by putting employment disputes in the hands of the CEO. Still, the league's position is clear ‚Äî it wants the Commissioner to retain power over disputes involving the NFL and the various teams that have hired and that handsomely compensate the Commissioner.

The 25-page document is the first step in an effort to persuade the Supreme Court to take up the case. Of the many petitions it receives each year, few are accepted.

More time will pass as the Supreme Court considers whether to take the case. Even more time will pass if the Supreme Court grants the petition.

The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit invalidated the NFL's arbitration provision, concluding that the procedure lacks independence. (And it does.) The Supreme Court, if it takes the case, will decide once and for all whether it's legitimate for the NFL (and any sports league) to put its Commissioner in charge of claims made against the NFL.

It's fundamentally unfair to delegate those powers to someone whose connection to one side of a legal fight is so obvious. Frankly, no Commissioner should want to be expected to set aside their clear self-interests in an effort to dispense justice in an objective way.

But this has been the league's practice, for years. It desperately wants to run its own business. It desperately hopes to hold the gavel when it comes to deciding whether the legal claims against it are valid.

It's a bad way to do business. It's now for the Supreme Court to decide whether it's a good way, or a bad way, to apply the laws of the United States.

title: Florida quarterback DJ Lagway reportedly commits to Baylor one day after visit with school
description: DJ Lagway will look for a bounce-back year with Baylor after a middling sophomore year at Florida.
fullText:
It didn't take long for Florida quarterback DJ Lagway to find a new team. Less than a month after announcing his intent to transfer, Lagway reportedly committed to Baylor, according to Rivals.com.

Lagway's decision comes a day after he visited the school and was spotted attending a Baylor basketball game with Bears football coach Dave Aranda.

BREAKING: Florida transfer QB DJ Lagway has committed to Baylor, @Hayesfawcett3 reportsüêªhttps://t.co/WDcp436N9Y pic.twitter.com/GeiyboBmFg

‚Äî On3 (@On3sports) January 8, 2026

Lagway, considered the top quarterback in the 2024 class, turned in a strong freshman season with the Gators. After starting the year on the bench, Lagway was pushed into the starting lineup following an injury to Graham Mertz.

Lagway threw for 456 yards and three scores in his first start, and then led Florida to a 6-1 record down the stretch, taking down multiple ranked opponents before beating Tulane in a bowl game.

That strong finish led to heightened expectations for both Lagway and Florida entering the 2025 season. Florida opened the year ranked No. 15 in the AP poll, and then rose to No. 13 after taking down LIU to kick off the season. But a loss to South Florida the following week dropped Florida out of the top-25.

That proved to be a harbinger of what was to come. Florida finished the year 4-8 and failed to jump back into the top-25 the rest of the way.

Lagway played a significant role in the team's demise. After being limited by shoulder issues last offseason, Lagway didn't play up to expectations as a sophomore, finishing the year with just 16 touchdowns and 14 interceptions in 12 games.

title: Browns LB Devin Bush wins AFC Defensive Player of the Week
description: Browns linebacker Devin Bush has not only expressed his desire to return to Cleveland, but also took home AFC Defensive Player of the Week honors
fullText:
Cleveland Browns linebacker Devin Bush has been named the AFC Defensive Player of the Week for the final week of the 2025 regular season, the team announced Wednesday.

The honor caps a resurgent campaign for the veteran linebacker, who delivered his finest performance of the year this past Sunday.

In the Week 18 finale against the Cincinnati Bengals, Bush was enforcer. He led the defense with 14 total tackles, consistently disrupting the Bengals' offensive rhythm. His defining moment came in the final minute of the first quarter.

DEVIN BUSH 97-YARD PICK-6 FOR THE BROWNS!

CLEvsCIN on CBS/Paramount+https://t.co/HkKw7uXVnt pic.twitter.com/TuiEnrZajf

With Joe Burrow driving deep into Cleveland territory, Bush intercepted a pass and sprinted 97 yards for a touchdown. The pick-six not only put the Browns on the scoreboard but also shifted the game‚Äôs momentum, serving as the catalyst for the team's fifth win.

The award serves as a fitting conclusion to a career year for Bush. He finished the 2025 season with personal bests across the board, tallying 125 total tackles, 63 of which were solo stops. He also displayed remarkable versatility as a playmaker, recording three interceptions, eight pass deflections, two forced fumbles, two sacks, and two defensive touchdowns.

His ability to impact the game in coverage, against the run, and as a blitzer has made him an indispensable cog in the Browns' defensive machine.

As the team transitions to the offseason, Bush‚Äôs future in Cleveland remains a key storyline.

His contract is set to expire, making him one of the more intriguing names in the upcoming free agency pool. According to Mary Kay Cabot of Cleveland.com, Bush has expressed a desire to return to the Browns.

However, retaining him will come at a price. Spotrac.com currently places Bush‚Äôs estimated market value at an $8.9 million yearly average.

Whether the Browns can structure a deal to keep him in Cleveland remains to be seen, but for now, Bush stands recognized as one of the AFC's premier defenders to close out the 2025 season.

This article originally appeared on Browns Wire: Browns LB Devin Bush wins AFC Defensive Player of the Week

title: Eagles lineman takes subtle jab at 49ers' Bryce Huff ahead of playoff matchup
description: Bryce Huff is facing his former team, and his ex-teammates expect him to be geared up to go.
fullText:
Eagles lineman takes subtle jab at 49ers' Bryce Huff ahead of playoff matchup originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The San Francisco 49ers are making the trip to face the Philadelphia Eagles in the first round of the playoffs.

This matchup between the 49ers and Eagles is bound to be a good one, and there's already an interesting storyline developing.

As Zach Berman of The Athletic shared, Eagles lineman Jordan Mailata took a subtle jab at 49ers defensive lineman Bryce Huff. While not a direct jab, it's one that can be taken a certain way based on how Huff's 2024 season went with the Eagles.

"100 percent," Mailata said when asked if Huff would be juiced for this matchup. "Can't wait to see Super Bowl-champ Bryce Huff."

Mailata's comments might not seem like much of a jab, but there's important context to know: Huff didn't play in the Super Bowl.

Huff was a healthy inactive for the Super Bowl, meaning he didn't contribute to the Eagles beating the Kansas City Chiefs to win their second Super Bowl title in franchise history.

While he was on the team and played for part of the 2024 season, Huff was not a big contributor to the Eagles winning the Super Bowl.

He struggled to generate sacks, wasn't great in the run game, and overall, was a step down from their other options, so much so that he was a healthy inactive for the biggest game of the season.

More:¬†Shanahan-era trend haunts 49ers again in NFC West loss

Mailata referring to him as "Super Bowl-champ Bryce Huff" can be taken as a jab at the former Eagles pass rusher.

He didn't help the Eagles win the Super Bowl, but while technically a Super Bowl champion, this quote from Mailata can be seen as tongue-in-cheek.

After the 2024 season with the Eagles, he was traded to the 49ers, and now, Huff will get to face his former team as the Eagles and 49ers face off for the first time in the playoffs since their infamous last meeting.

This is the first playoff matchup since the Eagles and 49ers NFC Conference Championship in 2023, when Brock Purdy and Josh Johnson both got hurt, and the 49ers had little to no chance of winning.

title: Farke on not risking players, 'love' for the cup and Perri criticism
description: Leeds United boss Daniel Farke has been speaking to the media before Sunday's FA Cup third round tie against Derby County at Pride Park (kick-off 12:00 GMT).  It is a part of life and he will never be forgotten - he will always be part of our Leeds family.  The Leeds boss confirmed that if it is "risky" to do so, then he will not play Jayden Bogle at Derby and it will "more or less be the same group of players as for the last game" who are available, with Sam Byram a "little question mark" because of a back problem.
fullText:
Leeds United boss Daniel Farke has been speaking to the media before Sunday's FA Cup third round tie against Derby County at Pride Park (kick-off 12:00 GMT).

Here are the key lines from his news conference:

Farke began by paying tribute to club legend Terry Yorath, who has died at the age of 75: "Very sad news. All our thoughts and prayers are with his family. Very sad news for us, a proper club legend. Always sad to hear this. It is a part of life and he will never be forgotten - he will always be part of our Leeds family. His legacy will live forever."

The Leeds boss confirmed that if it is "risky" to do so, then he will not play Jayden Bogle at Derby and it will "more or less be the same group of players as for the last game" who are available, with Sam Byram a "little question mark" because of a back problem.

Despite a "tough run" of four games in 10 days, Farke insisted he is a "big believer in cup competitions" and "loves this traditional cup". However, despite always wanting to win the FA Cup, he also acknowledged the "big priority this season is to stay in the Premier League, so we won't risk any players".

He added: "I don't want to come across that it is over-ambition off back of defeat that I want to win a major competition. We know it is not realistic as promoted side, but we have shown, whether it be a quarter-final, semi-final, final, against top sides we are capable to win this. But to get there, you have to make sure you win early rounds and we respect Derby."

Farke confirmed that Karl Darlow will start in goal on Sunday, and on Lucas Perri, who has come under criticism for recent mistakes, he said: "Always like to be open and honest about everything. Of course, last few games Lucas had situations he could have saved and decision-making wasn't great. It is better not to hide this fact and talk nonsense. Important to hold hand up and be self-critical."

He added: "You can't just take praise, have to take negative aspects too. And if you don't meet expectations then you will get criticised. I'd rather try not to sugar-coat it and be honest about it, instead of hiding behind elephant in the room."

With Joel Piroe and Jack Harrison struggling for game time in recent weeks, Farke explained how highly he rates Piroe for his "finishing skills" and this is important for them in games they dominate, but it is "not failure of Joel" that they have had to alter their approach recently. He also praised Harrison for being "professional" and when an opportunity next comes, he "has to use it and shine".

Listen to live commentary of Derby County v Leeds United at 12:00 GMT on BBC Radio 5 Live, BBC Radio Leeds and BBC Radio Derby, plus follow on the BBC Sport website and app

title: Red Sox predicted to sign $150M World Series Champion, Gold Glove winner after Rafael Devers fiasco
description: The Red Sox know exactly what must be done before the end of the offseason.
fullText:
Red Sox predicted to sign $150M World Series Champion, Gold Glove winner after Rafael Devers fiasco originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Boston Red Sox signed Alex Bregman last offseason, but the deal included opt-outs. After the conclusion of the 2025 season, it became clear that Bregman would hit the free-agent market after just one season in Boston.

‚ÄúAlex Bregman plans to opt out of his contract with the Boston Red Sox, a source told ESPN on Tuesday night, confirming a New York Post report. The move was expected and doesn't rule out the veteran third baseman returning to Boston, but for now, he will be part of the free agent class for a second straight offseason,‚Äù ESPN reported.

The Red Sox are optimistic about their chances of bringing Bregman back, but the Philadelphia Phillies could also be in the mix.

‚ÄúIf the Phillies were to move Bohm, in my judgment, it would have to be because they think there's a chance of getting a Bregman or they're one of the teams potentially that could look at a Bo Bichette at a spot that's not shortstop," MLB insider Jon Morosi said. "There's different ways they could augment their club, but you would have to have a clear upgrade on Bohm if you're gonna go ahead and make that trade."

Sports Illustrated‚Äôs Will Laws believes the Red Sox will ultimately get the job done and re-sign Bregman.

‚ÄúBregman opted out of his contract just one year into his three-year, $120 million deal in Boston. A quad injury cost him about a month-and-a-half in the middle of the year, but he was otherwise productive at the plate after a relatively down 2024 campaign. Bregman‚Äôs approach is sound, with minimal swing-and-miss and a good command of the strike zone, and his defense remains at least solid at the hot corner, so it seems likely he‚Äôll get four- or five-year offers from teams this time around. Bregman assumed a leadership role last year with the Red Sox, who appear motivated to sign a star infielder,‚Äù Laws wrote.

The Red Sox would love to have Bregman back, particularly for the experience and leadership he provides. Boston made the playoffs last year and believes it can repeat that success.

Bringing Bregman back would also generate excitement around the city. With Spring Training just a month away, expect the Red Sox to move quickly to work out a deal.

title: Juventus make initial contact for Juventus‚Äô Bernardo Silva
description: Juventus have reignited their pursuit of Bernardo Silva as the Portuguese playmaker prepares to enter the final months of his illustrious tenure at Manchester City. According to an exclusive report by...
fullText:
Juventus have reignited their pursuit of Bernardo Silva as the Portuguese playmaker prepares to enter the final months of his illustrious tenure at Manchester City. According to an exclusive report by Mirko Di Natale for TuttoJuve, the Bianconeri have made fresh contact to express their interest in the 31-year-old, whose contract at the Etihad Stadium is set to expire in June.

Notably, Juventus are positioning themselves as serious contenders in what is expected to be a crowded race for the midfielder‚Äôs signature. With Silva available as a free agent in the summer, Cristiano Giuntoli is keen to lay the groundwork early to beat out a host of elite European clubs. Furthermore, this new approach signals a clear intent from the Turin giants to add world-class experience and creative flair to Luciano Spalletti‚Äôs midfield.

Indeed, while Manchester City have benefited from Silva‚Äôs brilliance for nearly a decade, his impending status as a free agent has made him the crown jewel of the upcoming summer market. Juventus have identified him as a priority target, viewing him as the ideal profile to elevate the squad‚Äôs technical level.

Consequently, as the January window progresses, the Bianconeri are expected to maintain constant dialogue with the player‚Äôs representatives. While a mid-season move remains highly unlikely, Juventus are determined to secure a pre-contract agreement to ensure Silva lands in Serie A for the 2026/27 campaign.

title: Jaguars' Thursday practice status update for wild-card game v. Bills
description: Here is the latest status update from the Jacksonville Jaguars' Thursday practice as they prepare for the Bills.
fullText:
The Jacksonville Jaguars are back on the practice field on Thursday for their second practice of the week as they continue preparing for their AFC wild-card matchup with the Buffalo Bills.

Wednesday's practice was a walkthrough. As of Wednesday, Liam Coen said it was still "TBD" as to whether or not the Jaguars would practice in pads this week. If they do, that'll happen on Thursday.

The Jaguars' official injury report will come out later this afternoon, but until then, here is the latest wild-card practice status update from those in attendance.

According to Ryan O'Halloran of the Florida Times-Union, as was the case on Wednesday, offensive lineman Cole Van Lanen and cornerback Jarrian Jones were not present at Thursday's practice.

No Cole Van Lanen and Jarrian Jones.

‚Äî Ryan O'Halloran (@ryanohalloran) January 8, 2026

On the Wednesday injury report, both were listed as non-participants. Van Lanen was out with a knee injury and Jones with an illness.

With Patrick Mekari back at practice in a limited capacity, Walker Little has likely been at left tackle these past two days, filling in for Van Lanen.

The other 51 players on the Jaguars roster are practicing. As of Wednesday, Greg Newsome, Montaric Brown, and Danny Striggow were limited.

Check back later in the day for the Jaguars' official Thursday injury report.

title: D'Amore Drop: What Hiroshi Tanahashi understood better than anyone ‚Äî and how it led to a perfect sendoff
description: There are many ‚Äúright‚Äù ways for a legend to ride off into the sunset. NJPW legend Hiroshi Tanahashi just pulled off one of the best imaginable.
fullText:
You can count me among the many, many people in the industry who popped big at the news Matt Cardona has signed a new full-time deal with WWE.

Matt Cardona is literally the blueprint for how any talent should handle their post-WWE or post-major organization career. Matt had a hell of a first run as Zack Ryder in WWE from 2005 to 2020. Although many people believed he never really got his due, he certainly showed he‚Äôs a guy who can get himself over no matter how much or little time and opportunity he may have been afforded.

Long-time fans will know Matt was an early adopter of YouTube, using his own channel to tell deeper stories about himself and what wrestling means to him. Matt constantly thought of ways to help himself, even if he was bumping into a glass ceiling at WWE.

History kind of forgets that when Matt was part of that massive WWE COVID-era talent cull, he was initially lost in the mix. He had a two-date gig with AEW, Cody Rhodes helped bring him in, and while many expected him to sign there, for whatever reason it was underwhelming and that was it.

Matt was left kicking around until ‚Äî and Matt will be the first to tell you this ‚Äî his wife Chelsea Green (another one of the industry‚Äôs good people) told him, ‚ÄúYou should take every booking. It should feel like you are everywhere, all the time, and could appear in any promotion.‚Äù

Matt took that idea and crushed it. He did ‚Äúanti-Zack Ryder‚Äù matches and became the Death Match King in GCW, which Matt is so rightly proud of.

We brought Matt (and Chelsea) in regularly for TNA. Matt is effortless to work with. A pro‚Äôs pro. Easy on travel. Easy and fair to negotiate with. Easy to work with creatively. If you need something from him, it is a, 'Yes, let‚Äôs make that happen.'

I am so happy Matt got to do all the things on the indies over the past five years. He said all along his goal was to return to WWE, if he could go back on his own terms.

Well, after the fun appearance as Zack Ryder late last year in the Last Time Is Now Tournament, he‚Äôs on "SmackDown" full time as Matt Cardona, and it appears WWE is now cool with him continuing his collectibles and merch podcast, which they weren‚Äôt under the Vince McMahon regime.

Matt leaves behind a clear roadmap to wrestlers who get canned by WWE or AEW ‚Äî or, really, anyone who loses their ‚Äúdream job.‚Äù Reinvention is possible if you work hard and take chances on yourself.

Not surprisingly, when I launched my new Maple Leaf Pro promotion two years ago, I couldn‚Äôt wait to bring Matt in. He‚Äôs just a joy to deal with. Here‚Äôs his match vs Thom Latimer from MLP Resurrection.

On Jan. 4 at Wrestle Kingdom, it was the end of an era. Hiroshi Tanahashi retired that night. There is no overstating what that means to New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). Nobody carried that company longer or more consistently. He was the guy who showed up when NJPW needed stability and credibility, and he gave them both for years.

Like John Cena in WWE, Tanahashi was the standard. Night in, night out, tour after tour.

When people talk about New Japan‚Äôs modern identity, it starts with him. You can point to stars that came after, but he was the foundation. Even with Kazuchika Okada leaving. Even with Will Ospreay leaving. The company still exists in a recognizable form because Tanahashi rebuilt it in his image.

What Tanahashi understood better than almost anyone is how to evolve without clinging. He went from being the guy, to the star, to the legend, and then into leadership, without forcing himself into spots he no longer needed to prove he could hang in.

His body has taken a beating over the years, but he still knows exactly how to structure a match and connect with a crowd. The audience trusted him and, in top-drawer pro wrestling, that matters more than anything.

We talked all year last year about how someone like John Cena or Sting should go out. This was another example of getting it right. Not dragging it out. Not overstaying. Not pretending Father Time does not exist or can‚Äôt land a blow. Tanahashi stood in the center, gave everything he had left, and left with dignity. The result ‚Äî him losing to a returning Okada ‚Äî was never in doubt, and it should not have been.

Winning or losing, for him, was not the point.

The important thing is that Wrestle Kingdom ended with Tanahashi getting his flowers, but the show clearly pointed forward. Younger wrestlers were featured. Olympian Aaron Wolf made his debut and was booked perfectly and carefully. The next generation was given space. New Japan honored its past without getting stuck in it, and that is not easy to do. Tanahashi did not just retire. He left behind a structure that can actually continue.

There are many ‚Äúright‚Äù ways for a legend to ride off into the sunset.

This was one of the perfect ways.

I am excited to see what Jake Something ‚Äî now Jake Doyle ‚Äî can do in AEW. He debuted Wednesday night as part of The Don Callis Family. He has tremendous upside, and I think Tony Khan and the team can really position Jake into something special.

I‚Äôve known Jake a long time, close to 10 years at this point, going back to his early days on the independents. He has tremendous upside. He used to come into the Can-Am Dojo regularly with Hakeem Zane, who later became Rohit Raju in TNA. From very early on, Jake stood out physically and mentally. He was always someone we pegged as having real upside ‚Äî not a project, but a guy who, if slotted correctly, could become something meaningful.

One of the clearest memories I have is from the DeAngelo Williams mini-camp we ran to get Williams ready for his match at Slammiversary 2017. That was NFL star DeAngelo teaming with Moose against Eli Drake ‚Äî who's now LA Knight ‚Äî and Chris Masters.

In rehearsals, Jake played the role of Chris Masters, Joe Coleman played Eli Drake, DeAngelo played himself, and I ended up playing Moose. We had four days to get Williams ready for a 20-minute match, and Jake was a key part of that prep ‚Äî and even then, you could see how reliable and adaptable he was.

Physically, in 2026, Jake is right in his prime. He is around 6-foot-3, about 270 pounds, and he moves like someone much smaller. He is a legitimate heavyweight in an era where true heavyweights are becoming rare, especially in AEW, which is far deeper at junior heavyweight than super heavyweight.

We had big plans for Jake when he returned to TNA in 2023, but timing, injuries and circumstances never fully lined up the way we hoped.

After my departure, he became one of those guys who was ‚Äúthere‚Äù rather than someone being actively built. That happens more often than people realize. This AEW opportunity feels different though, especially with Callis as his mentor. If Jake hits the ground running like I know he can, people are going to see very quickly why we always believed in him.

The D'Amore Drop is a weekly guest column on Uncrowned written by Scott D‚ÄôAmore, the Canadian professional wrestling promoter, executive producer, trainer and former wrestler best known for his long-standing role with TNA/IMPACT Wrestling, where he served as head of creative. D‚ÄôAmore is the current owner of leading Canadian promotion Maple Leaf Pro Wrestling.

title: Florida State football: Punter Daniel Hughes commits, will transfer to FSU
description: The Seminoles have a new punter
fullText:
The Florida State Seminoles are welcoming a new punter to Tallahassee. Daniel Hughes, who spent the 2025 season with the New Mexico Lobos, is transferring to FSU.

Hughes is 27 years old and is originally from Melbourne, Australia, and stands 6-foot-5, weighing 235 pounds. He has three years of eligibility remaining and owns a 4.0 GPA. He has a respectable social media following as well, and this article sheds some light on his uniqueness.

Hughes had quite a year in New Mexico after spending his prior season in JUCO. He put up numbers that weren‚Äôt school records only due to lack of total number of punts in New Mexico‚Äôs excellent offense. His net average of 43.6 yards per punt (on 37 total punts) would have been good for the second-best mark in Mountain West Conference history in addition to becoming a New Mexico school record.

From the press release for his Honorable Mention All-Mountain West team selection:

Daniel Hughes¬†‚Äì Honorable Mention (P)

A Ray Guy Award semifinalist, he is averaging 45.9 yards per punt with a net of 43.6 on just 37 punts with 12 inside the 20 and 13 punts of 50 yards or more. He has not shown up in the stats all season because of the lack of punts by UNM, but would be 16th¬†nationally in punting.

New Mexico is seventh nationally in net punting, and the 43.6-yard average would easily be a school record, and it would be the second-best net punting mark in Mountain West history. He has averaged at least 46.0 yards per punt in seven of the 12 games this season (and it‚Äôs really seven of 11 as UNM didn‚Äôt punt against Nevada). Opponents are averaging 3.9 per return, and opponents have muffed three of his punts (8.1%).

Junior College: Lettered in football for one season at City College of San Francisco ‚Ä¶ played in 10 games as a freshman, punting 49 times for a 37.3 yard average ‚Ä¶ had a long of 62 ‚Ä¶ pinned his opponents inside the 20 18 times on the season and forced 13 fair catches ‚Ä¶ had just two touchbacks.

High School: Hughes did not play football at Mount Erin ‚Ä¶ he did play Footy in the Victorian Football League (VFL), playing for the Northern Bullants in 2021 and 2022, seeing action in 15 games.

title: Packers to practice inside Lambeau Field before playoff showdown with Bears
description: The Packers' final official practice before facing the Bears will be run inside Lambeau Field on Thursday.
fullText:
The Green Bay Packers closed off media access to practice and are holding Thursday's practice inside Lambeau Field due to the conditions at the team's practice field across the street, according to coach Matt LaFleur.

LaFleur said players were "concerned about footing" outdoors at Clarke Hinkle Field, and the Packers want to make sure they get a good practice session in on Thursday before going to Chicago to play the Bears in the playoff rubber match on Saturday.

"Nothing top secret about it. What we've decided to do is go into Lambeau," LaFleur said Thursday. "A lot of it is just, the grass inside Lambeau is better than that at our practice field. It hasn't been great on our practice field this year. I think a lot of it is due to the weather and the amount of precipitation we've gotten, so it's a little bit softer. Lambeau is in better shape, so we'd rather go there."

Thursday is the final official practice of the week. The Packers don't have to worry about chewing up the surface inside Lambeau Field because, as the No. 7 seed in the NFC playoffs, the team will not play another home game this season.

"It's best to get a quality practice in Lambeau," LaFleur said.

The Packers will play at Soldier Field on Saturday night. LaFleur was more worried about the wind factor in Chicago than the surface of Soldier Field, which has a reputation for being poor, no matter the time of year.

"I thought it was fine the last time we played down there," LaFleur said.

It's possible Soldier Field will be wet and soft on Saturday night. A mix of rain and snow is expected Saturday in Chicago.

Practice report from Tom Silverstein of the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel:

Practice pool report from me: The #Packers held their stretch inside the CRIC. This is the segment that is open to the media on Fridays. Everybody took part in the warm-ups except RT Zach Tom. Coach Matt LaFleur said in his press conference that Tom was being given a day off.

‚Äî Tom Silverstein (@TomSilverstein) January 8, 2026

This article originally appeared on Packers Wire: Packers to practice inside Lambeau Field before playoff showdown with Bears

title: Ex-Detroit Lions WR Calvin Johnson admits to smoking pot while playing
description: Former Detroit Lions wide receiver Calvin Johnson admitted to smoking pot while playing on a podcast with current Lions WR Amon-Ra St. Brown.
fullText:
Former Detroit Lions wide receiver Calvin Johnson sparked up an interesting discussion with current Lions wide receiver Amon-Ra St. Brown recently.

In an episode of the "St. Brown Podcast" released on Wednesday, Jan. 7, Johnson admitted to smoking cannabis before games "a handful of times" late in his career, indicating that he used the substance to help deal with pain.

"I was at this point where I was like, 'Man, I don't know how how the hell I'm going to get through this game today,'" he said. "And I'd be like, 'You know what, [expletive] it, I'm gonna spark this thing up.'"

The Pro Football Hall of Famer is one of the most decorated players in franchise history, reaching the Pro Bowl six times and being named a first-team All-Pro three times in his nine-year career from 2007-15, all spent with the Lions. He eclipsed over 1,000 receiving yards seven times in his NFL career, including in each of his last six seasons before retiring in 2016.

Johnson said he only smoked before home games and doesn't believe the cannabis had a negative impact on his performance.

"The funny thing is, more times than not, I had a good game, too," he said.

Johnson didn't specify when he smoked and which games were impacted, but it may not be a surprise that Johnson used cannabis throughout his career. Johnson advocated for better pain management in his Hall of Fame induction speech and founded cannabis research company Primitiv Group in 2021 with former Detroit Lions guard Rob Sims.

Though cannabis remains a banned substance in the NFL, the league agreed to relax some of its drug policies related to cannabis in 2024, including raising the THC threshold needed to trigger a positive result and lowering fines for offenders.

Need¬†to catch up on the news during your lunch break?¬†

You can reach Christian at cromo@freepress.com.

This article originally appeared on Detroit Free Press: Calvin Johnson, ex-Detroit Lions WR, says he smoked pot while playing

title: Algeria apologises after player mocks Congolese superfan dressed as pan-African hero
description: Michel Nkuka Mboladinga stood motionless throughout DR Congo's Afcon matches in tribute to Patrice Lumumba.
fullText:
Algeria's football federation has apologised to a Congolese superfan who has become one of the stars of the Africa Cup of Nations (Afcon) being held in Morocco.

Michel Nkuka Mboladinga has supported the Democratic Republic of Congo by dressing up as the country's revered first leader Patrice Lumumba and remaining stock-still throughout every match.

He stood on a pedestal with his right arm raised - just like Lumumba's famous statue in DR Congo's capital, Kinshasa - as fans around him cheered.

But after Algeria beat the Leopards on Tuesday, Algerian player Mohamed Amine Amoura faced a backlash for mimicking Mboladinga and falling to the ground as though the statue had been knocked over.

This prompted the 25-year-old forward to post an apology on Instagram, saying his gesture was not intended to disrespect DR Congo.

Why Belgium is returning an African hero's golden tooth

Full BBC Africa football coverage

The Desert Foxes had looked like they were heading to penalties before Adil Boulbina scored in the 119th minute, securing a place in the quarter-finals where they face Nigeria on Saturday.

"At that moment, I wasn't aware of what the person or symbol in the stands represented. I simply wanted to joke around, in a good-natured way, without any ill intent or desire to provoke anyone," said Amoura, who also plays for German team Wolfsburg.

Lumumba is not only seen as a hero in DR Congo, where he was assassinated in 1961 in a plot backed by Belgium, the UK and the US, but is also regarded as one of the most prominent voices in Africa's anti-colonial movement.

After the final whistle on Tuesday at Rabat's Moulay Hassan Stadium, which saw the Leopards knocked out of the tournament, Mboladinga - who with his hairstyle and glasses looks remarkably like Lumumba - was visibly distraught.

He removed his glasses to wipe away some tears, slowly got down from his makeshift plinth and leant against it with his head in his hands.

The Algerian Football Association (Faf) reached out to Mboladinga following Amoura's contrite statement and invited him to the hotel where the North African team are staying in Rabat to meet the players.

The superfan was not able to get to Morocco's capital so Faf's media officer Sa√Ød Fellak travelled to Casablanca's Novotel Hotel to see him and other Congolese supporters on Wednesday evening.

There Fellak presented Mboladinga with his own Desert Foxes jersey with the name "Lumumba" printed on the back.

Videos and photos of the entente cordiale, also attended by Congolese Sports Minister Didier Budimbu, were captured by Congolese fans, showing Mboladinga next to Fellak with his new football shirt.

It is not clear if the Lumumba superfan and his pedestal will make it to Mexico, where the Leopards are expected to play in March's highly anticipated intercontinental World Cup qualifiers.

Six teams will compete to be allocated the final two places up for grabs for the World Cup, which kicks off in June.

Algeria have already qualified for the tournament that is being jointly hosted by Canada, Mexico and the United States - and Amoura hopes that he will get to see the Leopards there too.

"I respect Congo and their team. Honestly, I wish them the best and hope they qualify for the World Cup," he said.

Additional reporting by Algerian football journalist Maher Mezahi

title: Is Kewan Lacy related to Kyren Lacy? Explaining the last name connection for Ole Miss RB
description: The Ole Miss star running back and Ole Miss are two wins away from their first national championship in program history.
fullText:
Is Kewan Lacy related to Kyren Lacy? Explaining the last name connection for Ole Miss RB originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

In the College Football Playoff semifinals, there is no player more electric than running back Kewan Lacy. The Ole Miss Rebels running back has lit it up all season, and now, Pete Golding's team is two wins away from their first national championship (in the title game era) in program history.

Lacy has been one of the most dynamic players in college football this season, placing in the top three in FBS with 1,464 rushing yards and 23 touchdowns, finding paydirt in all but one game. If Ole Miss is going to continue its magical run, expect No. 5 to be at the center of it.

But, the Ole Miss star is not the first Lacy to light up the SEC; a few years ago, Kyren Lacy of LSU¬†‚Äî who passed away in April 2025¬†‚Äî¬†was one of the most dynamic players in the South. That begs the question: are the two related?

Here's more on Lacy and his ties to the former LSU receiver.

MORE 2026 COLLEGE FOOTBALL PLAYOFF NEWS:

Expert picks for Indiana vs. Oregon CFP semifinal

Ranking four teams remaining in College Football Playoff

Predictions for Ole Miss vs. Miami CFP semifinal

Despite sharing the surname of Lacy and both being prominent collegiate football players from the South, Kyren Lacy and Kewan Lacy are not related by blood.

Kyren Lacy, the wide receiver who played for LSU, is a Louisiana native from Thibodaux, born to Kenny and Kandace Lacy. In contrast, Kewan Lacy, the running back who attends Ole Miss, is a Texas native from the Dallas area and is the son of Kendra McGrew.

MORE:¬†Who is Ole Miss coach Pete Golding?

No, Kewan Lacy is not related to Eddie Lacy.

Both are known for being superstar running backs in the SEC. Eddie played four years at Alabama (2009-2012), where he won three BCS national championships and rushed for over 2,400 yards and 30 touchdowns.

Kewan transferred from Missouri to Ole Miss in the offseason and has lit it up for the Rebels in his first year in Oxford. The SEC's second-leading rusher has the Rebels two wins away from a national championship.

MORE:¬†Five players to watch in the Fiesta Bowl

There's not tons of information available about Lacy's parents.

He is the son of Kendra McGrew. Additional details about his family are not provided in the available context, though it is known that he is a real estate major and made the Athletic Director's Honor Roll in the spring of 2025 at Ole Miss.

His older brother, Gerald Lacy Jr., committed to Ole Miss on Jan. 7. The defensive back played one season at¬†Trinity Valley Community College.

MORE: How¬†much money Lane Kiffin makes for Ole Miss' College Football Playoff wins

Kewan Lacy is from Dallas, Texas, although he initially attended Fort Worth Nolan for his freshman and sophomore years. For his junior and senior seasons, he played at Lancaster High School in Lancaster, Texas. During his time in high school, he showed significant versatility and explosive playmaking ability, particularly during his sophomore year where he rushed for 1,352 yards and 13 touchdowns on just 135 carries, establishing himself as a highly-rated running back prospect.

Kewan Lacy is putting up historic numbers üìà pic.twitter.com/Nz9j3r2tRH

‚Äî SEC Network (@SECNetwork) January 7, 2026

Kewan's college career began at the University of Missouri in 2024, where he appeared in six games as a freshman, rushing for 104 yards. Following his freshman season, he entered the transfer portal and committed to Ole Miss (2025‚Äìpresent). His move to Ole Miss proved successful, as he became a major contributor, notably totaling 1,464 rushing yards and 23 touchdowns in his sophomore year, ranking him third in the country in rushing and second in rushing touchdowns.

MORE:¬†Has Ole Miss ever won a national championship in football?

title: Demond Williams transfer portal controversy, explained: Why Washington is blocking QB from leaving recent contract
description: The Huskies' starting QB appears to be in a unique situation after attempting to enter the transfer portal.
fullText:
Demond Williams transfer portal controversy, explained: Why Washington is blocking QB from leaving recent contract originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Washington Huskies quarterback Demond Williams, coming off a 31-total-touchdown season in the Big Ten as a sophomore, announced Tuesday that he would be entering the transfer portal.

In 2026, that's almost become the norm for big-name college quarterbacks. Plenty of star passers, from Dylan Raiola to DJ Lagway, made exits from their schools this college football offseason. But in Williams' case, his announced decision sparked controversy.

Just days before Williams' transfer announcement,¬†he had reportedly agreed to return to the Huskies for the 2026 season, signing a contract to do so. And in response to his attempted exit, Washington is "prepared to pursue all legal avenues" if Williams is not living up to that deal.

Here's everything to know about Demond Williams' transfer portal controversy.

MORE:Tracking the QBs on the move in the transfer portal

Williams, who spent the first two seasons of his career at Washington and excelled as a sophomore starter in 2025, shared an Instagram post on Tuesday announcing he'd be entering the transfer portal.

"I have to do what is best for me and my future," he wrote. "After much thought and prayer, I will be entering the transfer portal."

The problem, however, was that Williams had already signed a contract to return to the Huskies last week, per ESPN's Pete Thamel. The deal was reportedly considered "top of the market," and Thamel also added that Williams entered the portal with a "do not contact" tag, meaning he likely already had a destination in mind.

According to Thamel, Washington is now "prepared to pursue all legal avenues to enforce Williams' signed contract," and the quarterback's situation has also "drawn the attention of the Big Ten."

Ross Dellenger also reported that Washington officials "suspect" that another school contacted Williams after he had already signed his Huskies deal. In response, Washington reportedly plans to submit evidence of tampering. On Wednesday, Dellenger added that Big Ten commissioner Tony Pelitti has become "heavily involved in the matter."

According to Matt Zenitz, LSU, which is still eyeing a quarterback after landing Lane Kiffin, is expected to be the "team to watch" for Williams if he's able to transfer.

On Wednesday, Pete Nakos reported that Washington has no plans to enter Williams' name in the transfer portal due to his signed contract. The Big Ten is "standing behind UW's¬†fervent approach to the contract," per Dellenger.

Washington officials are expected to meet Wednesday with Williams' representatives, and because the Huskies are refusing to enter Williams' name into the portal, he cannot hold conversations with other teams, per Dellenger.

On Thursday, Williams' agent, Doug Hendrickson, announced that he was dropping Williams as a client due to "philosophical differences."

‚Äî Doug Hendrickson (@DHendrickson41) January 8, 2026

MORE: How Lane Kiffin's transfer portal acquisitions at LSU have started roughly

Demond Williams had reportedly agreed to a deal with Washington days before he announced he would be entering the transfer portal.

An update thread on the Demond Williams situation with Washington, per sources to @YahooSports:
- Williams signed a one-year rev-share agreement with UW worth about $4M.
- The agreement is a Big Ten template document used by all league members and built for situations like this.

‚Äî Ross Dellenger (@RossDellenger) January 7, 2026

Pete Thamel reported that the contract had been "top of the market," while Ross Dellenger reported that¬†Washington officials described the contract as "a legally binding revenue-share contract with the school."

On Wednesday, Ross Dellenger provided further details about the contract. It was a one-year revenue-share agreement with Washington worth about $4 million, per Dellenger. The agreement "prohibits a player from entering the portal once signed" and "prohibits the player‚Äôs NIL rights to be used by any other school, though the player can sign outside marketing agreements."

Thamel also added that the¬†buyout of Williams' contact reads the cost of the buyout is in the ‚Äúsole discretion‚Äù of Washington, and it¬†specifically states that ‚Äúthe institution is not obligated to enter the Student-Athlete into the transfer portal or otherwise assist or facilitate the Student-Athlete‚Äôs transfer to another college or university.‚Äù

Here's a look at Williams' numbers through two seasons at Washington.

title: Puka Nacua wins PFF's Offensive Player of the Year after setting all-time grade record
description: Puka Nacua set records for the highest season grade, single-game grade and most contested catches in 2025
fullText:
Puka Nacua just turned in one of the best seasons ever by a wide receiver, leading the way for the Los Angeles Rams in Year 3 with the team. He caught an NFL-high 129 passes, finished second with 1,715 receiving yards and led the league with an average of 107.2 receiving yards per game.

His 1,7,15 yards are the 14th-most all-time in a single season and his 129 catches are the seventh-most in league history, all despite missing one game and parts of two others.

Based on the betting odds, it seems unlikely that Nacua will win Offensive Player of the Year over Jaxon Smith-Njigba, but Pro Football Focus recognized his greatness this season. PFF named Nacua its Offensive Player of the Year on Thursday thanks to his prolific 2025 campaign.

Nacua set the all-time wide receiver record with a season grade of 96.3 and had the most contested catches ever in a single season, hauling in 27 such receptions. His 3.71 yards per route run are also the third-most ever in PFF history.

Puka Nacua: PFF‚Äôs 2025 Offensive Player of the Year

üêè 96.3 PFF grade (PFF record)
üêè 3.71 yards per route run (3rd in PFF history)
üêè 27 contested catches (PFF record) pic.twitter.com/gSV1dCd0UW

Of the 10 highest single-game grades by a wide receiver, Nacua now owns two of them: 97.4 in Week 14 and 95.0 in Week 15. Julio Jones is the only other wideout with multiple grades in the top 10; he has three such games, including the second-best.

Nacua is the second Rams player to win an award from PFF this year, with Matthew Stafford also being named league MVP. They were two of the best overall players in the NFL regardless of position and PFF rightly recognized how outstanding they were in 2025.

This article originally appeared on Rams Wire: Rams' Puka Nacua wins PFF Offensive Player of the Year
